Genetically, Brucella microti CCM 4915 has been shown to have a distinct genome compared to other Brucella species, indicating its evolutionary divergence. Additionally, it exhibits unique phenotypic traits, such as its ability to grow at lower temperatures and its limited host range, primarily infecting small rodents like the common vole.

Research on Brucella microti CCM 4915 is ongoing to further understand its epidemiology, pathogenicity, and potential implications for human and animal health, as it represents a newly identified member of the Brucella genus.
